description: '''Broken beat''' (sometimes referred to as "'''bruk'''") is an [[electronic dance music]] genre that emerged in the late 1990s and is characterized by [[Syncopation|syncopated beats]] and frenetic, choppy rhythms, often alongside female vocals and elements inspired by 1970s [[jazz-funk]]. It has been heavily influenced by styles such as [[house music|house]], [[drum and bass]], [[hip hop music|hip hop]], [[techno]], [[acid jazz]], and [[contemporary R&B|R&B]]. The eclectic style generally avoided rigid [[four-on-the-floor]] rhythms and could make use of samplers, analogue synths, and live instrumentation.
